metadata.titel_preek: Advent: The Season of Shadows and the Coming Power

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God breaks into a dark, resistant world to establish His kingdom and reclaim His household through the arrival of the Messiah.

subject.identificatie: God / The One Who Comes (Jesus Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: It is he who put the whole operation in motion
A power from outside is coming... able to make a new creation

object.identificatie: The New Creation / Salvation of the Household
tekstueel_bewijs: to make a new creation out of people like us

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Master of the House
tekstueel_bewijs: established the household in the first place and gave it its reason for being
people who have no capacity of ourselves to save ourselves

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist / The Holy Spirit (implied grace)

tegenstander.identificatie: The Powers of Darkness / Sin / Human Resistance
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but a 'head-on collision' between the Kingdom and the powers of darkness.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church keeping watch and bearing fruit as a response to the Master's coming.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/vigilance) is explicitly fueled by the primary program (God's coming power).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: John the Baptist → God/Christ ← Powers of Darkness

voorbeelden_god_subject: God cares if you have a matched set
He will come in the future
It is God’s power that gives good deeds
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The church looks straight down into its own heart
We live at what the New Testament depicts as the turn of the ages

voorbeelden: He must not find us asleep
The Advent clock tells the church what time it is
I need power from outside myself to make me different
A power from outside is coming... able to make a new creation

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon moves from the 'Devoir' (Watch!) to the realization of human inability, concluding that only God's 'Pouvoir' enables the 'Devoir'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S1 (Cheapness) to S2 (Darkness/Judgment) to S1 (God's Power/Presence).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'One Who Comes' who brings the power to move from darkness to light.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; darkness and judgment are treated as ontological realities, not just metaphors.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects human capacity and identifies God as the sole source of both the desire and the ability to repent.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is God’s power that gives good deeds and inner strength.
The preacher is nothing; the Word is everything.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John the Baptist is used not as a moral hero to imitate, but as a 'spotlight' or 'witness' to the Light.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: John is a signpost pointing to God's action.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and dependency on external power.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative of the Master's return perfectly integrates the call to watch with the promise of power.
spanning_punten: The unbearable tension of living between two advents.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The kingdom of God is in head-on collision with the powers of darkness.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'absence of God' and a 'darkness' we cannot escape alone.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of all transformative verbs.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (Power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue to ground every 'must' in a 'God can'.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The cosmic nature of the opponent justifies the need for a Divine Subject.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids the trap of moralism by explicitly stating that even the 'willing' and 'doing' are gifts from the Sender.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'darkness' imagery, Greimasian analysis reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is the external endowment of competence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'metanoia'; semiotics shows how 'metanoia' is an Object given by God rather than a work performed by the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'watchman' is not the hero of the story, but a placeholder for the Master's power.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully navigates the 'Rutledge Rule' by making God the subject of the most critical active verbs regarding salvation and transformation.
